intro: Sedum rhodiola var. crispum, commonly known as the crinkled stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to arid and rocky environments. It features fleshy, crinkled leaves that help it store water, adapting to dry conditions. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow or orange, typically during the summer months. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a hardy choice for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Its compact growth habit and drought tolerance make it a popular ornamental plant in landscaping.
